text:
Hi everyone,
Currently, Gmail will cut off and display " _[Message clipped] View the entire message"_ at the bottom of your email if the email is larger than 102kb. When I click view the entire message , the email open in new window. The issue here is drag and drop two column module changes to one column module. Is there any solution for this?

Hi Binod, there is not; this is Google’s way of encouraging emails to stay light and simple and discourage lengthy “newsletter-style” emails. When I run into this issue, I try to refactor my messaging strategy such that the email is more of a “preview” of the newsletter (or whatever the current content is) and direct the user to click a CTA to go to the full version on a landing or web page. This also means you’re avoiding unnecessary cross-client design bug risks, as browsers are much more standardized compared to email clients.
